results.adx_keywords: United States Defense and Military Forces;Afghanistan War (2001- );Obama, Barack;Karzai, Hamid;United States International Relations;Defense Department;Taliban;Afghanistan
results.byline: By MARK MAZZETTI and MATTHEW ROSENBERG
results.title: U.S. Considers Faster Pullout in Afghanistan
results.abstract: President Obama, frustrated in his dealings with President Karzai, is considering speeding up troop withdrawals from Afghanistan and even leaving no American troops after 2014.
des_facet: UNITED STATES DEFENSE AND MILITARY FORCES

media.caption: The Obama-Karzai relationship has cooled recently.
American soldiers attended a naturalization ceremony on the Fourth of July at the Bagram Air Base north of Kabul.

results.adx_keywords: Boston Marathon Bombings (2013);Bauman, Jeff Jr;Therapy and Rehabilitation;Amputation;Legs;Physical Therapy
results.title: Beyond the Finish Line
results.abstract: Jeff Bauman went to the 2013 Boston Marathon to cheer for his girlfriend. In one flash, his life changed and an arduous road to recovery began.

media.caption: Waking up at Spaulding Rehabilitation Hospital. Jeff Bauman found it difficult to get any sleep because of the pain.
Bauman as the sutures were being removed from his amputated legs. He had been waiting for his girlfriend near the finish line of the Boston Marathon on April 15 when the first of two bombs detonated.
A resident at Boston Medical Center removing Bauman's sutures, a month after the bombings.
Medical responders and a bystander, Carlos Arredondo, center, rushed Bauman from the scene in what became a symbolic image of the Boston Marathon carnage.
At home, Bauman packed three tablets of the painkiller oxycodone in a baggie before going to a restaurant for his father’s 53rd birthday.
Carlyn Wells, Bauman’s physical therapist at Spaulding, measured his range of hip and leg motion.
Bauman joking with his girlfriend, Erin Hurley, whose first marathon he had gone to see.
Casts of Bauman's thighs were made to build the sockets for his prosthetic legs.
Bauman had a chance to examine a prosthetic leg for the first time.
Bauman and Carlos Arredondo, the bystander who had helped him, were introduced at Fenway Park on May 28 before throwing the ceremonial first pitch for a Red Sox game.
Bauman hanging out with friends, who were wearing bracelets with the words “Bauman Strong” on one side and “April 15, 2013” on the other.
At a final fitting for his prosthetic legs, Bauman walked on his own for the first time since the day of the marathon.

results.adx_keywords: Egypt;Morsi, Mohamed;Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- );Demonstrations, Protests, and Riots;Defense and Military Forces;Muslim Brotherhood (Egypt);Cairo (Egypt);Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat;Nour, Al-, Party (Egypt)
results.byline: By DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK and KAREEM FAHIM
results.title: Army Kills 51, Deepening Crisis in Egypt
results.abstract: In a sharp escalation of tensions Monday, Egyptian soldiers opened fire on hundreds of supporters of Mohamed Morsi, the ousted president, witnesses said. The military said armed assailants fired first.
des_facet: MIDDLE EAST AND NORTH AFRICA UNREST (2010- )
COUPS D'ETAT AND ATTEMPTED COUPS D'ETAT

media.caption: Wounded supporters of Mr. Morsi were treated in a makeshift hospital. At least 51 civilian demonstrators were killed and more than 400 were wounded, almost all of them by gunfire, health officials said.
media.copyright: Wissam Nassar for The New York Times

media.caption: Protests continued outside the Republican Guard officers’ club.
Monday’s clash was the second episode of deadly violence outside the military officers’ club since Mr. Morsi was deposed on Wednesday.
Supporters of Mohamed Morsi, Egypt’s deposed president, ran through what appeared to be tear gas on Monday outside the Republican Guard officers’ club in Cairo.

media.copyright: The New York Times; Aerial Imagery from Google

results.adx_keywords: Psychology and Psychologists;Research;Memory
results.title: What Is Nostalgia Good For? Quite a Bit, Research Shows
results.abstract: Nostalgia, long considered a disorder, is now recognized to counteract loneliness, boredom and anxiety — making life seem more meaningful and death less frightening.

results.adx_keywords: Asiana Airlines;Aviation Accidents and Safety;San Francisco (Calif);Fires and Firefighters;San Francisco International Airport
results.byline: By NORIMITSU ONISHI, CHRISTOPHER DREW, MATTHEW L. WALD and SARAH MASLIN NIR
results.title: Terror on Jet: Seeing Water, Not Runway
results.abstract: The pilot at the controls on Asiana Flight 214 was said to have had only 43 hours of experience flying a Boeing 777, and an airline spokeswoman said that it was his first time piloting a 777 into San Francisco.

media.caption: Investigators from the National Transportation Safety Board on Sunday at the scene of the crash of Asiana Airlines Flight 214 at San Francisco International Airport.
The parents of Wang Lin Jia, center, are comforted by parents of other students who were on the Asiana Airlines flight.
The United Airlines domestic terminal, which was crowded a day after the airport was closed.
Deborah Hersman, the transportation safety board chairwoman, and Mayor Edwin M. Lee.

Asiana Flight 214, arriving from Seoul, South Korea, broke apart and burst into flames as it crashed while landing at San Francisco International Airport. The plane’s tail, landing gear and one of its engines were ripped off.

results.title: Financial Crisis Just a Symptom of Detroit’s Woes
results.abstract: As officials negotiate in a last-ditch effort to spare the city the largest municipal bankruptcy in the nation’s history, residents say the city has worse problems than its $18 billion debt.

A family member of one of the two Chinese girls killed in Saturday’s crash wept while checking in for a flight from Shanghai.
People gathered for a memorial in Jiangshan, home of the crash victims, in the eastern Chinese province of Zhejiang.

results.byline: By JOHN SCHWARTZ and JONATHAN MARTIN
results.title: Perry Says He Won’t Seek Governorship Again in Texas
results.abstract: Rick Perry, the longest-serving governor of Texas, said he would instead “pray and reflect and work to determine my own future path.”

media.caption: Gov. Rick Perry of Texas, who has been in office since 2000, said he would not seek re-election but would “work to determine my own future path.”

results.title: Spitzer Quickly Hits Establishment Headwind
results.abstract: Former Gov. Eliot Spitzer began his effort to run for city comptroller, while mayoral hopefuls and New Yorkers debated whether he deserved a second chance.

media.caption: Former Gov. Eliot Spitzer had no trouble attracting attention on his first day on the trail.
Another Democratic candidate for comptroller, Scott M. Stringer, campaigned with his wife, Elyse Buxbaum.
Former Gov. Eliot Spitzer spoke to the news media and tried to collect signatures for his candidacy for city comptroller on Monday in Union Square.
